intro: Pterocaulon serrulatum var. serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
